parameters.content:
# ‚ö†Ô∏è ADVANCED USE ONLY

### üö® This workflow is for advanced users only!

This MCP server contains **104 operations** which is significantly more than the recommended maximum of 40 tools for most AI clients.

### üîç Recommended Alternative
**Seek a simplified MCP server** that utilizes the official n8n tool implementation for ClickMeter if available, as it will be more efficient and easier to manage.

### üõ†Ô∏è Advanced Usage Instructions

**BEFORE adding this MCP server to your client:**
### Disable or delete unused nodes - Review sections and disable/delete those you don't need

**AFTER adding the MCP server to your client:**
1.**Selective tool enabling** - Instead of enabling all tools (default), manually select only the specific tools you need for *that* Workflow's MCP client.
2. **Monitor performance** - Too many tools can slow down AI responses

### üí° Pro Tips
**Keep maximum 40 enabled tools** - Most AI clients perform better with fewer tools
- Group related operations and only enable one group at a time
- Use the overview note to understand what each operation group does
- Consider creating multiple smaller MCP servers for different use cases
- Ping me on [discord](https://discord.me/cfomodz) if your business needs this implemented professionally

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions

1. **Import Workflow**: 
Load this workflow into your n8n instance

2. **Configure Authentication**: 
Set up apiKey credentials
   - Type: API Key in header
   - Key name: X-Clickmeter-AuthKey

3. **Activate Workflow**:
Enable the workflow to start the MCP server

4. **Get MCP URL**: 
Copy the webhook URL from the MCP trigger

5. **Connect AI Agent**:
Use the MCP URL in your AI agent configuration


### üí° Usage Notes
‚Ä¢ Parameters are auto-populated by AI using $fromAI() expressions
‚Ä¢ With 104 API endpoints available as tools
‚Ä¢ Responses maintain original API structure


### üõ†Ô∏è Customization
‚Ä¢ Add data transformation nodes if needed
‚Ä¢ Implement custom error handling
‚Ä¢ Add logging or monitoring nodes

‚Ä¢ Modify parameter defaults in any HTTP request node as needed

### üí¨ Need Help?
Ping me on [discord](https://discord.me/cfomodz) for integration guidance and custom automations. Check the [n8n documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/sub-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.toolmcp/) for more information.

## üõ†Ô∏è ClickMeter MCP Server ‚úÖ 104 operations

### About
Api dashboard for ClickMeter API

### üîß How it Works

This workflow converts the ClickMeter API into an MCP-compatible interface for AI agents.

‚Ä¢ **MCP Trigger**: Serves as your server endpoint for AI agent requests
‚Ä¢ **HTTP Request Nodes**: Handle API calls to http://apiv2.clickmeter.com:80
‚Ä¢ **AI Expressions**: Automatically populate parameters via `$fromAI()` placeholders
‚Ä¢ **Native Integration**: Returns responses directly to the AI agent


### üìã Available Operations (104 endpoints)

**Account (19 operations)**
Retrieve, Update, Create, Delete, Change

**Aggregated (5 operations)**
Retrieve

**Click Stream (1 operations)**
Retrieve

**Conversions (15 operations)**
Retrieve, Create, Delete, Update, Modify, Fast

**Data Points (16 operations)**
List, Create, Retrieve, Delete, Update, Count, Get, Fast

**Domains (6 operations)**
Retrieve, Create, Delete, Get, Update

**Groups (17 operations)**
List, Create, Retrieve, Count, Delete, Get, Update, Fast

**Hits (1 operations)**
Retrieve

**Me (2 operations)**
Retrieve

**Re Targeting (8 operations)**
List, Creates, Retrieve, Deletes, Get, Updates, Count

**Tags (14 operations)**
List, Create, Delete, Retrieve, Count, Associate/Deassociate, Fast

parameters.toolDescription:
Retrieve permissions for a guest

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ guestId (required) - Id of the guest
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ entityType (optional) - Can be "datapoint" or "group"
  ‚Ä¢ offset (optional) - Offset where to start from
  ‚Ä¢ limit (optional) - Limit results to this number
  ‚Ä¢ type (optional) - Can be "w" or "r"
  ‚Ä¢ entityId (optional) - Optional id of the datapoint/group entity to filter by

  ‚Ä¢ hourly (optional) - If using "yesterday" or "today" timeframe you can ask for the hourly detail
  ‚Ä¢ onlyFavorites (optional)

  ‚Ä¢ status (optional) - Status of conversion ("deleted"/"active")

  ‚Ä¢ sortDirection (optional) - Direction of sort "asc" or "desc"
  ‚Ä¢ offset (optional) - Offset where to start from
  ‚Ä¢ limit (optional) - Limit results to this number
  ‚Ä¢ textSearch (optional) - Filter fields by this pattern

parameters.toolDescription:
Retrieve statistics about a subset of datapoints for a timeframe with datapoints data

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ timeFrame (required) - Timeframe of the request. See list at $timeframeList
  ‚Ä¢ type (required) - Type of datapoint ("tl"/"tp")
  ‚Ä¢ fromDay (optional) - If using a "custom" timeFrame you can specify the starting day (YYYYMMDD)
  ‚Ä¢ toDay (optional) - If using a "custom" timeFrame you can specify the ending day (YYYYMMDD)
  ‚Ä¢ status (optional) - Status of datapoint ("deleted"/"active"/"paused"/"spam")
  ‚Ä¢ tag (optional) - A comma separated list of tags you want to filter with.
  ‚Ä¢ favourite (optional) - Is the datapoint marked as favourite
  ‚Ä¢ sortBy (optional) - Field to sort by
  ‚Ä¢ sortDirection (optional) - Direction of sort "asc" or "desc"
  ‚Ä¢ offset (optional) - Offset where to start from
  ‚Ä¢ limit (optional) - Limit results to this number
  ‚Ä¢ groupId (optional) - Filter by this group id
  ‚Ä¢ textSearch (optional) - Filter fields by this pattern

parameters.toolDescription:
Retrieve the latest list of events of this account. Limited to last 100.

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ group (optional) - Filter by this group id (mutually exclusive with "datapoint" and "conversion")
  ‚Ä¢ datapoint (optional) - Filter by this datapoint id (mutually exclusive with "group" and "conversion")
  ‚Ä¢ conversion (optional) - Filter by this conversion id (mutually exclusive with "datapoint" and "group")
  ‚Ä¢ pageSize (optional) - Limit results to this number
  ‚Ä¢ filter (optional) - Filter event type ("spiders"/"uniques"/"nonuniques"/"conversions")

Retrieve a list of conversions

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ offset (optional) - Offset where to start from
  ‚Ä¢ limit (optional) - Limit results to this number
  ‚Ä¢ status (optional) - Status of conversion ("deleted"/"active")
  ‚Ä¢ textSearch (optional) - Filter fields by this pattern
  ‚Ä¢ createdAfter (optional) - Exclude conversions created before this date (YYYYMMDD)
  ‚Ä¢ createdBefore (optional) - Exclude conversions created after this date (YYYYMMDD)
Create a conversion

parameters.toolDescription:
List of all the datapoints associated to the user

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ offset (optional) - Where to start when retrieving elements. Default is 0 if not specified.
  ‚Ä¢ limit (optional) - Maximum elements to retrieve. Default to 20 if not specified.
  ‚Ä¢ type (optional) - Type of the datapoint ("tp"/"tl")
  ‚Ä¢ status (optional) - Status of the datapoint
  ‚Ä¢ tags (optional) - A comma separated list of tags you want to filter with.
  ‚Ä¢ textSearch (optional) - Filter fields by this pattern
  ‚Ä¢ onlyFavorites (optional) - Filter fields by favourite status
  ‚Ä¢ sortBy (optional) - Field to sort by
  ‚Ä¢ sortDirection (optional) - Direction of sort "asc" or "desc"
  ‚Ä¢ createdAfter (optional) - Exclude datapoints created before this date (YYYYMMDD)
  ‚Ä¢ createdBefore (optional) - Exclude datapoints created after this date (YYYYMMDD)

parameters.toolDescription:
Retrieve statistics about all datapoints of this customer for a timeframe grouped by some temporal entity (day/week/month)

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  ‚Ä¢ type (required) - Type of datapoint ("tl"/"tp")
  ‚Ä¢ timeFrame (required) - Timeframe of the request. See list at $timeframeList
  ‚Ä¢ fromDay (optional) - If using a "custom" timeFrame you can specify the starting day (YYYYMMDD)
  ‚Ä¢ toDay (optional) - If using a "custom" timeFrame you can specify the ending day (YYYYMMDD)
  ‚Ä¢ status (optional) - Status of datapoint ("deleted"/"active"/"paused"/"spam")
  ‚Ä¢ tag (optional) - A comma separated list of tags you want to filter with.
  ‚Ä¢ favourite (optional) - Is the datapoint is marked as favourite
  ‚Ä¢ groupBy (optional) - Temporal entity you want to group by ("week"/"month"). If unspecified is "day".
